column2: Support Management of the Governance standards by establishing frameworks, guidelines, policies, and processes.      Ensure Regional Medical Governance Database (detailed information by country) is maintained for countries in region by working with local Medical Contacts and RMGO for Region.      Support strategic and operational guidance in a plain language for medical activities.      Acts as a subject matter expert for some defined Governance and compliance aspects of region and educate or train other stakeholders on the process whenever required.      Supports in identifying potential areas to harmonize and create efficiencies across countries in the region and work closely with local global teams to address if any gaps identified.      Participate to the creation of new processes tailoring of existent ones in accordance with business imperatives and compliance standards.      Supports Medical team in cross functional projects to continuously improve Sanofi standards, policies, guidelines, and systems.      Supports local medical teams in identifying, managing medical local risks, and development of Risk plan to address risks identified, working in partnership with Compliance Officer within country and with other medical governance team members (global and local)      Identifies and escalates quality and compliance risks related to assigned regions and proposes mechanisms to mitigate risks.      Participate as required on with local medical staff as necessary on the internal control and EBI monitoring exercise and in case of audit or inspection.      Monitors internal controls to measure compliance and supports internal audit outcomes.      Works with Global and Local contacts on CAPA resolution following audit or inspection findings and ensures completion.      Supports Country site visits and internal or external audit/inspections as needed to ensure local implementation of Company Medical Standards and Regulatory requirements.      Share the best practices across the region including training, responses to inquiries, escalates requests as needed for appropriate responses.                People   : (1) Maintain effective relationships with stakeholders (local and global); (2) Work closely with all the relevant global medical vaccines team ( such as Medical Operations effectiveness team, Medical Excellence and Governance, Medical franchise teams, BOS Events team as needed); (3) Collaborate when applicable with all relevant internal stakeholders, such as Legal, Ethics and Business Integrity, Com Ops, Public Affair, RD, CMO, Pharmacovigilance, Quality and Internal control/auditors ;       Performance   : (1) Supports in managing medical governance requirements in the region and adhere to the compliance requirements; (2) manage the compliance during policy change or regulatory changes or system changes by providing a Governance framework (3) Support the implementation of global processes by adapting the local requirements and compliance; (4) Ensure that global and local compliance methodology and programs are integrated and well documented to demonstrate program effectiveness               Process   : (1) participate to the development of the Governance standards, frameworks for Medical affairs in the region and educate country or other relevant stakeholders on adherence; (2) harmonize the governance process or standards across countries in the region; (3) Create and develop a systematic quality compliance and controls (4) Assists in identification and escalates quality compliant risks and work on mitigation as directed (5) Supporting country audits (if required) on global process work on any identified Global CAPA.               Stakeholders   : (1) Regional Medical Governance Officers including Global Lead RMGO,(2) Medical, Excellence and Governance team, country / regional medical teams; (3) Legal, EBI, Public Affair teams (4) RD, CMO, Regulatory PV teams G (5) Quality And other functions to support medical governance compliance               About you         Experience:    7+ years of experience in Managing projects in medical domain with an operational knowledge in QA, Regulatory, EBI international regulations standards        Soft skills:    Strong administrative and organizational skills in complex set ups with agility, communication        Technical skills   : Basic MS Office skills, Smartsheet Project Management       Education   : Bachelor/Higher Degree/ Medical Doctor        Languages   : Excellent knowledge of English language (spoken and written)

column2: Are you looking for a highly visible medical writing role that broadens your project management capabilitiesIf so this Medical Writing Asset Lead role could be an ideal opportunity to consider.          As a Medical Writing Asset Lead, you will lead therapy area specific medical writing projects or programs as appropriate in support of the clinical strategy to meet business and regulatory needs, and potentially leading projects across products.               This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following            Provides key contributions to clinical strategy, including knowledge and understanding of regional and global regulatory requirements for writing clinical documents including, but not limited to, protocols, clinical study reports, clinical study register summaries, common technical document summaries and Clinical Overview, briefing documents for regulatory authorities, responses to regulatory authority questions, clinical sections of the IMPD for clinical trial applications, investigator brochures and annual reports.              Leads matrix teams in planning and production of multiple clinical documents to support regulatory submissions, working with CROs and/or independent contractors as needed. Ensures global approach for submissions as appropriate, including the use of core global modules, supplemented by local modules as necessary. Ideally works in collaboration with GRA to ensure business needs are met for new chemical entities and post approval documentation.             Plans and successfully implements large submissions independently or in conjunction with the Medical Writing Director, effectively recommending methods or innovative solutions for achieving accelerated timelines as necessary. Recommends solutions for problems that affect timelines. Provides guidance and facilitation to submission teams in development of detailed submission plan.             Ideally demonstrates an understanding of the interdependences of various contributing functions and manages problems affecting timelines as necessary. Ideally demonstrates an ability to quickly assess complex situations, apply scientific, operational and submission development knowledge to identify and implement effective plans for solutions.             Proposes resourcing solutions for major projects including number of FTEs required and best use of internal and external resource.             Effectively organizes content and arguments in complex clinical submission documents, including briefing documents and responses to regulatory questions. Acts as lead author on submissions.             Actively contributes to development of training materials for therapeutic area scientists and provides mentoring and/or training on clinical documentation and submission planning to individuals or teams. Ideally, proactively identifies medical writing training needs for staff and develops/implements training sessions.             Has ability to prioritise effectively and meet multiple deadlines successfully with attention to detail, demonstrating high performance standards for own work and encouraging similar standards across the matrix, ensuring standards are proactively applied across a submission.

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Unit Nursing Lead to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Provide leadership and direction to nursing staff within the assigned unit, including registered nurses, licensed practical nurses, and nursing assistants, to ensure the delivery of safe, effective, and compassionate patient care.      Coordinate and supervise nursing activities, including patient assessments, medication administration, treatments, and discharge planning, to promote optimal patient outcomes and continuity of care.      Collaborate with interdisciplinary team members, including physicians, therapists, social workers, and case managers, to develop and implement individualized care plans based on patient needs and treatment goals.      Monitor and evaluate nursing care delivery, patient acuity, and unit workflow to identify opportunities for process improvement, efficiency enhancements, and resource utilization optimization.      Conduct regular rounds on patients and nursing staff to assess patient satisfaction, address patient concerns, and provide feedback and support to nursing team members.      Serve as a clinical resource and mentor to nursing staff, providing guidance, education, and clinical supervision to promote professional growth, competency development, and evidence-based practice.      Ensure compliance with regulatory standards, nursing policies, and quality improvement initiatives related to patient safety, infection control, documentation, and accreditation requirements.      Participate in nursing leadership meetings, committees, and quality improvement projects to contribute to organizational goals, performance improvement efforts, and patient care initiatives.

column2: Medical Care: Pediatricians provide medical care to children from birth through adolescence. They diagnose and treat various health issues, including common illnesses, infections, injuries, and chronic conditions that affect children.     Well-Child Visits: Pediatricians play a crucial role in monitoring a child's growth and development. They conduct regular well-child visits to assess physical, cognitive, and emotional development, and provide vaccinations according to recommended schedules.     Preventive Care: Pediatricians emphasize preventive care, helping parents and caregivers understand how to maintain a child's health and prevent illnesses. This includes guidance on nutrition, physical activity, safety, and immunizations.     Specialized Care: Some pediatricians specialize in specific areas, such as neonatology (care of newborns), pediatric cardiology (heart conditions in children), pediatric endocrinology (hormonal disorders), and pediatric gastroenterology (digestive system disorders), among others.     Diagnosis and Treatment: Pediatricians diagnose and treat a wide range of conditions, including respiratory infections, allergies, asthma, diabetes, developmental delays, behavioral issues, and more. They often work closely with other healthcare professionals to provide comprehensive care.
